alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 23 at 1:33PM MST until December 23 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern Quay County in east central New Mexico... Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 200 PM MST. * At 133 PM MST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Tucumcari to 8 miles west of Pep, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Tucumcari, Texico, Melrose, San Jon, Dora, Grady, Causey, and Glenrio. This includes State Road 104 near Mile Marker 105. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
